<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	-63-
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#CDXC_10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The total interest expenses related the term loan, including cash interest payments, the amortizations of debt issuance costs and debt discount, and the accrual of end of term charge were approximately $554,000 and $112,000 for the years ended January 2, 2016 and January 3, 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On September 29, 2014, the Company entered into a loan and security agreement (the &#8220;Loan Agreement&#8221;) with Hercules Technology II, L.P., as lender (&#8220;Lender&#8221;) and Hercules Technology Growth Capital, Inc., as agent. Lender provided us with access to a term loan of up to $5 million. The first $2.5 million of the term loan was funded at closing. The first advance was to be repaid in equal monthly installments of principal and interest (mortgage style) through the loan&#8217;s maturity on April 1, 2018, following an initial interest-only period that was to conclude on October 31, 2015.&#160;In connection with the loan, the Company paid a $50,000 facility charge to Lender and recorded as debt issuance cost.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The term loan bears interest at the rate per year equal to the greater of either (i) 9.35% plus the prime rate as reported in The Wall Street Journal minus 3.25%, or (ii) 9.35%. The interest rate as of January 2, 2016 was 9.60%.&#160;&#160;The Company may prepay all, but no less than all, of the outstanding loan balance, subject to prepayment charges of 3% during the first twelve months following closing, 2% during the next twelve months and 1% thereafter. On the earliest to occur of the (a) the loan maturity date, (b) the date the Company prepays the outstanding loan balance or (c) the date the outstanding loan balance becomes due and payable, the Company will pay Lender an end of term charge equal to 3.75% of all amounts drawn under the loan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Loan Agreement further provides that, subject to certain conditions, any regularly scheduled installment of principal due to Lender may be paid, in whole or in part at the option of the Company or Lender, by converting a portion of the principal of the term loan into shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock (the &#8220;Conversion Shares&#8221;) at a conversion price of $1.293, in lieu of payment in cash.&#160;&#160;The aggregate principal amount to be paid in Conversion Shares shall not exceed $1,000,000.&#160;&#160;Of this amount 50% shall convert at the Lender&#8217;s option and 50% shall convert at the Company&#8217;s option.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Pursuant to the Loan Agreement, the Company issued Lender a warrant (the &#8220;Warrant&#8221;) to purchase 419,020 shares of our common stock at an exercise price of $1.062 per share, subject to customary anti-dilution provisions.&#160;&#160;&#160;The Warrant is exercisable and expires five years from the date of issuance.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In connection with the Loan Agreement, the Company granted first priority liens and security interest in substantially all of our assets, exclusive of intellectual property and 35% of the capital stock of any foreign subsidiary, as collateral for the obligations under the Loan Agreement.&#160;&#160;The Loan Agreement also contains representations and warranties by the Company and Lender, indemnification provisions in favor of Lender and customary covenants, and events of default.&#160;&#160;Upon the occurrence of an event of default, a default interest rate of an additional 4% will be applied to the outstanding loan balances, and Lender may terminate its lending commitment, declare all outstanding obligations immediately due and payable, and take such other actions as set forth in the Loan Agreement.&#160;&#160;We are currently in compliance with all loan covenants.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On June 17, 2015, the Company and Hercules Technology II, L.P entered into Amendment No. 1 (the &#8220;Amendment&#8221;) to the Loan Agreement. Pursuant to the Amendment, the parties agreed that the interest only period shall be extended to March 31, 2016.&#160;&#160;The maturity date remains unchanged at April 1, 2018 and any remaining principal balance of the loan and all unpaid interest shall be due on the maturity date.&#160;&#160;The Amendment became effective on June 18, 2015 upon the funding of the full amount of the $2.5 million second advance and payment of a nonrenewable facility fee of $15,000.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The second advance of $2.5 million is treated as if the Company entered into a separate loan.&#160;&#160;The facility fee of $15,000 is treated as debt issuance costs and are being amortized as interest expense using the effective interest method over the term of the loan.&#160;&#160;There is also additional $94,000 end of term charge the Company will pay, which is 3.75% of the $2.5 million drawn.&#160;&#160;The end of term charge is being accrued as additional interest expense using the effective interest rate method over the term of the loan.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	-64-
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#CDXC_10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company determined that the amended terms of the first advance of $2.5 million on September 29, 2014 were not substantially different from the original terms.&#160;&#160;The Company reflected the change prospectively as yield adjustments, based on the revised terms.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Debt Issuance Costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	and End of Term Charge
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company incurred debt issuance costs of approximately $103,000 and $15,000 for the first and second advance, respectively, in connection with this term loan.&#160;&#160;The debt issuance costs are being amortized as interest expense using the effective interest method over the term of the loan.&#160;&#160;Amortization of debt issuance costs were $41,000 and $12,000 for the years ended January 2, 2016 and January 3, 2015 and the remaining unamortized debt issuance costs of $65,000 are presented as a direct deduction from the carrying amount of the debt liability.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Company will pay an end of term charge of $188,000, which is 3.75% of the $5.0 million drawn under the loan.&#160;&#160;The end of term charge is being accrued as additional interest expense using the effective interest rate method over the term of the loan.&#160;&#160;The Company accrued $58,000 and $10,000 of this fee during the years ended January 2, 2016 and January 3, 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company determined the Warrant issued to Lender during the year ended January 3, 2015 to be equity classified.&#160;&#160;The Company estimated the fair value of this Warrant as of the issuance date using a Black-Scholes option pricing model with the following assumptions:

<BR>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">

	&#160;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="9%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	1.76
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	%
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company utilized this fair value in its allocation of the loan proceeds between loan payable and the Warrant which was performed on a relative fair value basis.&#160;&#160;The fair value of the Warrant to purchase 419,020 shares of our common stock was approximately $273,000.&#160;&#160;Ultimately, the Company allocated $246,000 to the Warrant and recognized this amount in additional paid in capital.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, this amount is recognized as a debt discount and is being amortized as interest expense using the effective interest method over the term of the loan.&#160;&#160;Amortizations of this debt discount were $90,000 and $28,000 for the years ended January 2, 2016 and January 3, 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_37"></A>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	At January 2, 2016 and January 3, 2015, the Company maintained a full valuation allowance against the entire deferred income tax balance which resulted in an effective tax rates of 0.2%, 0% and 0% for years 2015, 2014 and 2013, respectively.&#160;&#160;The valuation allowance increased by $381,000 as of January 2, 2016.

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company has tax net operating loss carryforwards for federal and state income tax purposes of approximately $29,006,000
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	and $23,610,000, respectively which begin to expire in the year ending December&#160;31, 2023 and 2016, respectively.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Company has tax capital loss carry forward available to offset future federal taxable capital income of approximately $2,065,000 which will expire in the year ending December 31, 2019.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Under the Internal Revenue Code, certain ownership changes may subject the Company to annual limitations on the utilization of its net operating loss carryforward.&#160;&#160;The Company will continue to analyze the potential impact of any additional transactions undertaken upon the utilization of the net operating losses on a go forward basis.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company has not identified any uncertain tax positions requiring a reserve as of January 2, 2016 and January 3, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#CDXC_10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="CDXC_10K_HTM_SHAREBASED">
	Note 9.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Share-Based Compensation
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="CDXC_10K_HTM_EMPLOYEESHAREBASED9A">
	9A. Employee Share-Based Compensation
</A>
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Stock Option Plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	At the discretion of the Company&#8217;s compensation committee (the &#8220;Compensation Committee&#8221;), and with the approval of the Company&#8217;s board of directors (the &#8220;Board of Directors&#8221;), the Company may grant options to purchase the Company&#8217;s common stock to certain individuals from time to time. Management and the Compensation Committee determine the terms of awards which include the exercise price, vesting conditions and expiration dates at the time of grant. Expiration dates for stock options are not to exceed 10 years from their date of issuance. The Company, under its Second Amended and Restated 2007 Equity Incentive Plan, is authorized to issue stock options that total no more than 20% of the shares of common stock issued and outstanding, as determined on a fully diluted basis.&#160;&#160;Beginning in 2007, stock options were no longer issuable under the Company&#8217;s 2000 Non-Qualified Incentive Stock Plan.&#160;&#160;The remaining amount available for issuance under the Second Amended and Restated 2007 Equity Incentive Plan totaled 3,321,226 at January 2, 2016. The stock option awards generally vest ratably over a four-year period following grant date after a passage of time.&#160;&#160;However, some stock option awards are performance based and vest based on the achievement of certain criteria established by the Compensation Committee, subject to approval by the Board of Directors.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The fair value of the Company&#8217;s stock options was estimated at the date of grant using the Black-Scholes based option valuation model.&#160;&#160;The table below outlines the weighted average assumptions for options granted to employees during the years ended January 2, 2016, January 3, 2015 and December 28, 2013.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>

<TR>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PX SOLID">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">

	Year Ended December
</FONT>

</TD>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="BORDER-BOTTOM: BLACK 2PX SOLID">

	2015

</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	1) Service Period Based Stock Options
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The majority of options granted by the Company are comprised of service based options granted to employees.&#160;&#160;These options vest ratably over a defined
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	period following grant date after a passage of a service period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

	The aggregate intrinsic values in the table
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	above are based on the Company&#8217;s closing stock price of $1.22 on the last day of business for the year ended January 2, 2016.&#160;&#160;The aggregate intrinsic values for options exercised during the years ended January 2, 2016, January 3, 2015, and December 28, 2013 were approximately $58,000, $156,000 and $7,000 respectively.
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	2) Performance Based Stock Options
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company also grants stock option awards that are performance based and vest based on the achievement of certain criteria established from time to time by the Compensation Committee.&#160;&#160;If these performance criteria are not met, the compensation expenses are not recognized and the expenses that have been recognized will be reversed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

	As of January 2, 2016, there was approximately $1,805,000 of total unrecognized compensation expense related to non-vested share-based compensation arrangements granted under the plans for employee stock options. That cost is expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 2.36 years.

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Restricted stock awards granted by the Company to employees have vesting conditions that are unique to each award.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	During the year ended January 2, 2016, several members of the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors (the &#8220;Board&#8221;) resigned from the Board and received immediate vesting of their unvested restricted stock of 520,000 shares.&#160;&#160;The expense for the vested restricted stock was recognized during the fiscal year ended January 3, 2015.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On January 2, 2014, the Company awarded an aggregate of 1,090,000 shares of restricted stock to the Company&#8217;s officers and members of the Board.&#160;&#160;The award includes the vested shares described above for members who resigned from the Board.&#160;&#160;These shares were to vest upon the earlier to occur of the following: (i) the market price of the Company&#8217;s stock exceeds a certain price, or (ii) one of other certain triggering events, including the termination of the officers and members of the board of directors without cause for any reason.&#160;&#160;The fair values of these restricted stock awards were $1,536,900 in aggregate, and they were based on the trading price of the Company&#8217;s common stock on the date of grant.&#160;&#160;The expense related to the restricted stock award has been amortized over the period of six months through July 1, 2014, as the Company determined the requisite service period to be 6 months as that is when they are eligible to vest.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>

</A>
</FONT>

<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Subsequent to the year ended January 2, 2016, the Company and each of the executives and members of the Board amended the restricted stock awards to provide that the awards shall not vest upon the market price of the Company&#8217;s stock exceeding a certain price or listing of the Company&#8217;s stock on a national securities exchange.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Employee Option
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	and Restricted Stock Compensation
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company recognized share-based compensation expense of approximately $1,543,000, $2,747,000 and $958,000 in general and administrative expenses in the statement of operations for the years ended January 2, 2016, January 3, 2015 and December 28, 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">

<A NAME="CDXC_10K_HTM_NONEMPLOYEESHARE">
	9B.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Non-Employee Share-Based Compensation
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	Stock Option Plan
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	At the discretion of management, working with the Compensation Committee, and with approval of the Board of Directors, the Company may grant options to purchase the Company&#8217;s common stock to certain individuals from time to time who are not employees of the Company.&#160;&#160;These options are granted under the Second Amended and Restated 2007 Equity Incentive Plan of the Company and are granted on the same terms as those being issued to employees.&#160;&#160;Stock options granted to non-employees are accounted for using the fair value approach.&#160;&#160;The fair value of non-employee option grants are estimated using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model and are re-measured over the vesting term until earned.&#160;&#160;The estimated fair value is expensed over the applicable service period.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The following table summarizes activity of stock options granted to non-employees:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;$549,961
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	-70-
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#CDXC_10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The aggregate intrinsic values in the table above are, based on the Company&#8217;s closing stock price of $1.22 on the last day of business for the year ended January 2, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Stock and Restricted Stock Awards
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Restricted stock awards granted by the Company to non-employees generally feature time vesting service conditions, specified in the respective service agreements.&#160;&#160;Restricted stock awards issued to non-employees are accounted for at current fair value through the vesting period.&#160;&#160;On January 27, 2015, the Company awarded 350,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock to non-employees.&#160;&#160;210,000 of these shares were treated as stock awards as the shares vested immediately on the date of award, and the remaining 140,000 shares, which were initially treated as unvested restricted stock, vested on May 28, 2015.&#160;&#160;The fair values of the awards, which totaled approximately $350,000, were measured based on the trading prices of the Company&#8217;s stock on the date of award and the date vested.&#160;&#160;The expense related to these stock awards were fully recognized during the twelve-month period ended January 2, 2016.
</FONT>
<BR>
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In addition, 24,000 shares of restricted stock that were granted to a certain non-employee during the fiscal year ended January 3, 2015 became vested during the twelve-month period ended January 2, 2016.&#160;&#160;The fair value of these vested restricted shares was approximately $30,000, which represents the market value of the Company&#8217;s common stock on respective vesting dates charged to expense.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	As of January 2, 2016, there was approximately $63,000 of total unrecognized compensation expense related to the restricted stock award to a non-employee.&#160;&#160;That cost is expected to be recognized over a period of 2.2 years as of January 2, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	There were also stock awards made in 2014, which the Company has recognized a portion of the expense in 2015 as the required service periods extended into 2015.&#160;&#160;During the twelve months ended January 3, 3015, the Company awarded an aggregate of 65,000 shares and recognized a total expense of approximately $129,000. During the twelve months ended December 28, 2013, the Company awarded an aggregate of 600,000 shares and recognized a total expense of approximately $325,000.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Warrant Awards
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On October 27, 2014, the Company awarded a warrant to purchase 50,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock with an exercise price of $1.10 per share.&#160;&#160;The term of the warrant was 2 years.&#160;&#160;This warrant has not been exercised as of January 2, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On August 7, 2012, the Company awarded a warrant to purchase 250,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock with an exercise price of $0.75 per share.&#160;&#160;The term of the warrant was 2 years.&#160;&#160;On December 9, 2013, the non-employee who held the warrant elected a cashless exercise pursuant to the provisions of the warrant and received 74,186 shares of common stock in lieu of 250,000 shares for a cash payment of $0.75 per share.&#160;&#160;The intrinsic value of the warrant exercised was approximately $91,000.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Non-Employee Option, Stock,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Restricted Stock and Warrant Awards
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	For non-employee share-based compensation, the Company recognized share-based compensation expense of approximately $435,000, $170,000 and $330,000 in general and administrative expenses in the statement of operations for the years ended January 2, 2016, January 3, 2015 and December 28, 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="CDXC_10K_HTM_STOCKISSUANCENOTE10">
	Note 10.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Stock Issuance
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On November 4, 2015, the Company entered into Securities Purchase Agreements (&#8220;SPAs&#8221;) with certain existing stockholders to raise $2,000,000 in a registered direct offering.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the SPAs, the Company sold a total of 200,000 Units at a purchase price of $10.00 per Unit, with each Unit consisting of eight shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock and a warrant to purchase four shares of common stock (800,000 total) with an exercise price of $1.50 and a term of 3 years.&#160;&#160;The aggregate estimated fair value of the warrants was approximately $489,000 and these warrants were determined to be classified as equity.&#160;&#160;The fair value was estimated at the date of issuance using the Black-Scholes based valuation model.&#160;&#160;The table below outlines the assumptions for the warrants issued.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In Fiscal Year 2014, the Company issued 126,605 shares of common stock to vendors to settle outstanding payables balances of approximately $146,000.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In Fiscal Year 2013, the Company sold approximately 3.5 million shares with gross proceeds of approximately $3.0 million to two strategic accredited investors pursuant to a subscription agreement.&#160;&#160;A total placement agent fee of $20,000 was incurred in connection with the investments.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<A NAME="CDXC_10K_HTM_CANDCNOTE12">
	Note 12.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Commitments and Contingencies
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Lease
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company leases its office and research facilities in California, Colorado and Maryland under operating lease agreements that expire at various dates from April 2016 through September 2019.&#160;&#160;Monthly lease payments range from $1,424 per month to $23,472 per month, and minimum lease payments escalate during the terms of the leases. Generally accepted accounting principles require total minimum lease payments to be recognized as rent expense on a straight-line basis over the term of the lease. The excess of such expense over amounts required to be paid under the lease agreement is carried as a liability on the Company&#8217;s consolidated balance sheet.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Minimum future rental payments under
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	all of the leases as of January 2, 2016 are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">

	Table of Contents
</A>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Rent expense was approximately $536,000, $537,000, and $519,000 for the years ended January 2, 2016, January 3, 2015 and December 28, 2013, respectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Subsequent to the year ended January 2, 2016, the Company entered into a lease amendment to extend the term of the lease for its research facility located in Boulder, Colorado through April 2023.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the lease amendment, the Company will make monthly lease payments range from $23,472 to $27,210, as the payments escalate during the term of the lease.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Subsequent to the year ended January 2, 2016, the Company entered into a lease amendment to lease an office space located in Rockville, Maryland through April 2021.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the lease amendment, the Company will make monthly lease payments range from $3,450 to $3,883, as the payments escalate during the term of the lease.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Royalty
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company has 11 licensing agreements with leading research universities and other patent holders, pursuant to which the Company acquired patents related to certain products the Company offers to its customers.&#160;&#160;These agreements afford for future royalty payments based on contractual minimums and expire at various dates from December 31, 2019 through April 12, 2032.&#160;&#160;Yearly minimum royalty payments including license maintenance fees range from $5,000 per year to $50,000 per year, however, these minimum payments escalate each year with a maximum of $200,000 per year.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Company is required to pay a range of 2% to 8% of sales related to the licensed products under these agreements.&#160;&#160;Total royalty expenses including license maintenance fees from continuing operations for the years ended January 2, 2016, January 3, 2015 and December 28, 2013 were approximately $583,000, $323,000 and $111,000, respectively under these agreements.&#160;&#160;Minimum royalties including license maintenance fees for the next five years are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Legal proceedings
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company from time to time is involved in legal proceedings in the ordinary course of our business, which can include employment claims, product claims and patent infringements.&#160;&#160;We do not believe that any of these claims and proceedings against us as they arise are likely to have, individually or in the aggregate, a material adverse effect on our financial condition or results of operations.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Severance payments to executive officers
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	As of January 2, 2016, the Company has three executive officers, Frank Jaksch, Jr., Chief Executive Officer, Thomas Varvaro, Chief Financial Officer and Troy A. Rhonemus, Chief Executive Officer.&#160;&#160;Upon termination, Mr. Jaksch, Mr. Varvaro and Mr. Rhonemus will receive severance payments per the terms of the respective employment agreements entered with the Company.&#160;&#160;The key terms of the employment agreements, including the severance terms are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Employment Agreement with Frank L. Jaksch Jr
</FONT>
	.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On April 19, 2010, the Company entered into an Amended and Restated Employment Agreement (the &#8220;Jaksch Agreement&#8221;) with Frank L. Jaksch Jr. The Jaksch Agreement automatically renews unless terminated in accordance with its terms. On January 2, 2014, the Board approved raising the annual base salary of Mr. Jaksch to $275,000 per year and the annual cash bonus target up to 50% of his base salary.&#160;&#160;On March 14, 2016, the Board increased the base salary of Mr. Jaksch to $320,000.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	-74-
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="2">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage77"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 9PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A HREF="#CDXC_10K_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The severance terms provide that in the event Mr.&#160;Jaksch&#8217;s employment with the Company is terminated voluntarily, he will be entitled to any accrued but unpaid base salary, any stock vested through the date of his termination and a pro-rated portion of 50% of his salary for the bonus.&#160;&#160;In addition, if Mr.&#160;Jaksch leaves the Company for &#8220;Good Reason&#8221;, (as defined in Jaksch Agreement), he will also be entitled to severance equal to 50% of his salary, and he will be deemed to have been employed for the entirety of such year. Severance will then consist of 16 weeks of paid salary, unless Mr.&#160;Jaksch signs a release, in which case he will receive compensation up to 12 months paid salary.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In the event the Company terminates Mr. Jaksch&#8217;s employment &#8220;without Cause&#8221; (as defined in the Jaksch Agreement), Mr. Jaksch will be entitled to severance in the form of any stock vested through the date of his termination and continuation of his base salary for a period of eight weeks, or, if Mr. Jaksch enters into a standard separation agreement, Mr. Jaksch will receive continuation of base salary and health benefits, together with applicable fringe benefits until 24 months from the date of termination (the &#8220;Severance Period&#8221;), and he will receive a bonus of 50% of his base salary as well as the full vesting of any otherwise unvested stock.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Employment Agreement with Thomas C. Varvaro
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On April&#160;19, 2010, the Company entered into an Amended and Restated Employment Agreement (the &#8220;Varvaro Agreement&#8221;) with Thomas C. Varvaro. The Varvaro Agreement automatically renews unless terminated in accordance with its terms. On January 2, 2014, the Board approved raising the annual base salary of Mr. Varvaro to $225,000 per year and raising the annual cash bonus target up to 40% of his base salary.&#160;&#160;On March 14, 2016, the Board increased the base salary of Mr. Varvaro to $250,000.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The severance terms provide that in the event Mr.&#160;Varvaro&#8217;s employment with us is terminated voluntarily, he will be entitled to any accrued but unpaid base salary, any stock vested through the date of his termination and a pro-rated portion of 40% of his salary for the bonus. In addition, if Mr.&#160;Varvaro leaves the Company for &#8220;Good Reason&#8221; (as defined in the Varvaro Agreement), he will also be entitled to severance equal to 50% of his salary, and he shall be deemed to have been employed for the entirety of such year. Severance will then consist of 16 weeks of paid salary, unless Mr.&#160;Varvaro signs a release, in which case he will receive compensation up to 12 months paid salary.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In the event the Company terminates Mr. Varvaro&#8217;s employment &#8220;without Cause,&#8221; Mr. Varvaro will be entitled to severance in the form of any stock vested through the date of his termination and continuation of his base salary for a period of eight weeks, or, if Mr. Varvaro enters into a standard separation agreement, Mr. Varvaro will receive continuation of base salary and health benefits, together with applicable fringe benefits until 24 months from the date of termination (the &#8220;Severance Period&#8221;), will receive a bonus of 40% of his base salary as well as the full vesting of any otherwise unvested stock.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<FONT STYLE="TEXT-DECORATION: UNDERLINE; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Employment Agreement with Troy A. Rhonemus
</FONT>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On March 6, 2014, the Company entered into an Employment Agreement (the &#8220;Rhonemus Agreement&#8221;) with Mr. Troy Rhonemus pursuant to which Mr. Rhonemus was appointed to serve as the Chief Operating Officer of the Company.&#160;&#160;On March 17, 2015, the Board increased the base salary to $190,000.&#160;&#160;The Rhonemus Agreement provides for an annual cash bonus (based on performance targets) of up to 30% of his base salary.&#160;&#160;On March 14, 2016, the Board increased the base salary of Mr. Rhonemus to $210,000.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Upon termination, Mr. Rhonemus will be entitled to any accrued but unpaid base salary and any accrued but unpaid welfare and retirement benefits up to the termination date.&#160;&#160;In addition, if Mr. Rhonemus leaves the Company for &#8220;Good Reason&#8221; (as defined in the Rhonemus Agreement), he will also be entitled to severance equal to two weeks of base salary for each full year of service to a maximum of eight weeks of the base salary.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	-75-
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In the event the Company terminates Mr. Rhonemus&#8217; employment &#8220;without Cause,&#8221; Mr. Rhonemus will be entitled to severance equal to two weeks of base salary for each full year of service to a maximum of eight weeks of the base salary, or, if Mr. Rhonemus enters into a standard separation agreement, Mr. Rhonemus will receive continuation of base salary and health benefits, together with applicable fringe benefits as provided until the expiration of the term or renewal term then in effect, however, that in the case of medical and dental insurance, until the expiration of 12 months from the date of termination.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="CDXC_10K_HTM_RELATEDTRANSACTIONS">
	Note 13. Related Party Transactions
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On August 28, 2015, the Company entered into an Exclusive Supply Agreement (the &#8220;Supply Agreement&#8221;) with Healthspan Research, LLC (&#8220;Healthspan&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Under the terms of the Supply Agreement, Healthspan agreed to purchase NIAGEN&#174; from the Company and the Company granted to Healthspan worldwide rights for resale of specific dietary supplements containing NIAGEN&#174; in certain markets.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Pursuant to the terms of the Supply Agreement, in exchange for a 4% equity interest in Healthspan, the Company agreed to initially supply NIAGEN&#174; to Healthspan free of charge and thereafter at a fixed price and, in exchange for an additional 5% equity interest in Healthspan, the Company will grant to Healthspan certain exclusive rights to resell NIAGEN&#174; in certain direct response channels.&#160;&#160;&#160;Healthspan will pay the Company royalties on the cumulative worldwide net sales of its finished products containing NIAGEN&#174;.&#160;&#160;The exclusivity rights will remain for so long as Healthspan meets certain minimum purchase requirements.&#160;&#160;In the event that, during the initial term, the Company terminates the exclusivity rights due to failure to meet the minimum purchase requirements or for any reason other than a material breach of the Supply Agreement by Healthspan, then the 5% equity interest shall be automatically redeemed for a purchase price of $1.00 effective upon the date of termination of the exclusivity rights.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	In connection with the foregoing, also on August 28, 2015, the Company and Healthspan entered into an interest purchase agreement and limited liability company agreement pursuant to which the Company was issued 9% of the outstanding equity interests of Healthspan.&#160;&#160;Rob Fried, a director of the Company, is the manager of Healthspan and owns 91% of the outstanding equity interests of Healthspan.&#160;&#160;The Supply Agreement, interest purchase agreement and limited liability company agreement were unanimously approved by the independent directors of the Company.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	As of January 2, 2016, the Company had not shipped any NIAGEN&#174; to Healthspan and Healthspan did not issue any equity interests to the Company.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, there is no accounting recognition of this arrangement for the twelve-month period ended on January 2, 2016.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="CDXC_10K_HTM_BUSINESSSEGNOTE14">
	Note 14. Business Segmentation and Geographical Distribution
</A>
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Since the year ended December 28, 2013, the Company has generated significant revenue from its ingredients operations and has made operational changes, including changes in the organizational structure to support the ingredients operations.&#160;&#160;As a result, on December 29, 2013, the Company began segregating its financial results for ingredients operations, and has following three reportable segments.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Ingredients segment develops and commercializes proprietary-based ingredient technologies and supplies these ingredients to the manufacturers of consumer products in various industries including the nutritional supplement, food and beverage and animal health industries.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ID="LIST" WIDTH="100%" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 36PT">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; DISPLAY: INLINE" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#183;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Core standards, and contract services segment includes supply of phytochemical reference standards, which are small quantities of plant-based compounds typically used to research an array of potential attributes, reference materials, and related contract services.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV>
	&#160;
</DIV>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="40%">
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Net sales
</FONT>
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Revenues from international sources for the ingredients segment approximated $277,000, $35,000 and $22,000 for the years ended January 2, 2016, January 3, 2015 and December 28, 2013, respectively.&#160;&#160;Revenues from international sources for the core standards and contract services segment approximated $1,651,000, $1,756,000 and $1,488,000 for the years ended January 2, 2016, January 3, 2015 and December 28, 2013, respectively.&#160;&#160;Revenues from international sources for the scientific and regulatory consulting segment approximated $283,000, $104,000 and $450,000 for the years ended January 2, 2016, January 3, 2015 and December 28, 2013, respectively.&#160;&#160;International sources which the Company generates revenue include Europe, North America, South America, Asia, and Oceania.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	The Company&#8217;s long-lived assets are located within the United States.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Disclosure of major customers
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	During the year ended January 2, 2016 Customer B in our ingredients segment accounted for 11.0% of the Company&#8217;s total sales.&#160;&#160;Customer B accounted for less than 10% of the Company&#8217;s total sales for the years ended January 3, 2015 and December 28, 2013.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	During the year ended January 3, 2015, Customer A in our ingredients segment accounted for 10.2% of the Company&#8217;s total sales.&#160;&#160;Customer A accounted for less than 10% of the Company&#8217;s total sales for the years ended January 2, 2016 and December 28, 2013.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<EFX_SUBSEQUENT_EVENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_SUBSEQUENT_EVENTS"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Note 16. Subsequent Events
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	Subsequent to the year ended January 2, 2016, the Company entered into Securities Purchase Agreement (&#8220;SPA&#8221;) with&#160;an existing stockholder to raise $500,000 in a registered direct offering.&#160;&#160;Pursuant to the SPA, the Company sold a total of 384,615 Units at a purchase price of $1.30 per Unit, with each Unit consisting of one share of the Company&#8217;s common stock and a warrant to purchase one half of a share of common stock with an exercise price of $1.60 and a term of 3 years.&#160;&#160;The offering was made pursuant to a prospectus supplement dated March 11, 2016 and an accompanying prospectus dated May 8, 2015 pursuant to the Company&#8217;s shelf registration statement on Form S-3 that was filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on May 8, 2015 and became effective on June 5, 2015 (File No. 333-203204). The prospectus supplement registered the shares of common stock issued in the offering and the common stock underlying the warrants.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	On March 14, 2016, the Board of Directors increased the base salaries of Frank L. Jaksch Jr., Thomas C. Varvaro and Troy A. Rhonemus, the Company&#8217;s Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer and Chief Operating Officer, respectively.&#160;&#160;Effective as of March 14, 2016, the base salary for Mr. Jaksch increased from $275,000 to $320,000, an increase of 16.4%, the base salary for Mr. Varvaro increased from $225,000 to $250,000, an increase of 11.1%, and the base salary for Mr. Rhonemus increased from $190,000 to $210,000, an increase of 10.5%.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; DISPLAY: INLINE">
<A NAME="CDXC_10K_HTM_ITEM9">
	Item 9.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure
</A>

</DIV>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; DISPLAY: INLINE">
	We have had no disagreements with our independent registered public accounting firm on accounting and financial disclosure.
</FONT>
